meanings.sent1: Losing his job was beggaring him, leaving him with no money for food.
meanings.sent2: The natural disaster beggared many families in the area, forcing them to seek help.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a squirrel beggaring a bear for nuts is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her extravagant spending habits were slowly beggaring her financially.
meanings.sent5: The sudden illness beggared the family, draining all their savings in medical bills.

meanings.definition: To make someone seem insignificant or inadequate.
meanings.sent1: Constantly criticizing her work was beggaring her efforts to improve.
meanings.sent2: His rude remarks were beggaring her self-esteem, making her doubt her abilities.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant beggaring the mighty elephant in the story was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The loud applause for the guest speaker beggared the efforts of the previous presenters.
meanings.sent5: Her exceptional talent in painting beggared the skills of her peers, making her stand out.

meanings.sent1: The new technology beggared all previous inventions in terms of efficiency.
meanings.sent2: His dedication to his craft beggared that of his colleagues, earning him recognition.
meanings.sent3: The speed of the cheetah beggared that of all other land animals.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset beggared any painting or photograph of it.
meanings.sent5: The flavor of the homemade pie beggared that of any store-bought dessert.
